Das Spiel ist nach wie vor der beste PvP Hero-Shooter auf dem Markt.

Der einzige Grund für die ganzen schlechten Bewertungen sind einfach nur Blizzard Hater, TF2 Fans, Leute die mit der neuen Monetarisierung nicht happy sind und Leute, die nicht zufrieden damit sind, dass "PvE gecancelt" wurde.

Die einzigen, die ich wirklich nachvollziehen kann, sind diejenigen, die mit dem "gecancelten PvE" nicht zufrieden sind, was nicht mal ganz stimmt, da lediglich die Helden-Missionen und die Skilltrees der einzelnen Helden gecancelt wurden. 

Das einzige womit ich nicht wirklich zufrieden bin ist der Preis der neuen Story-Missionen. 15€ für die Story-Missionen sind m.M.n etwas zu viel, aber dafür sind die immerhin ganz gut geworden. Hoffentlich bleibt es bei dieser Qualität (und evtl. niedrigeren Preisen in Zukunft)

The season 6 Invasion bundle currently takes your money, and gives you nothing in game. As per usual a rushed piece of mediocre content that is bugged beyond belief.

Though it is store related so I expect this to get fixed quickly as it affects their bottom line.

GG Blizzard still needs to get their shit sorted and stop being a money grab company when making a good game that people want to play could have been far more profitable.

[h1][b] Here it is, Overwatch 2 on Steam.
If you have even a bit of respect for your money and yourself do NOT spend your time (and money) on this game. [/b][/h1]

Overwatch 2 doesn't feel like the original used to be. It used to be a [b]team[/b] based hero shooter with a rock, paper, scissors design, what I mean by that is that Hero A can be countered by Hero B, Hero B by Hero C and so on. Doesn't feel like that anymore, game feels like a giant slugfest after the OW2 [i]"upgrade"[/i]. When Overwatch 2 came about they remove 2 capture point mode (Known as assault. Temple of Anubis, Hanamura, Volskaya Industries) that I LOVED, because it was a mode that really needed team coordination on both sides (Attack, Defense) to work, and introduced a Push mode that I don't think it is as fun the removed ones. The design of the push maps feel very strange to me also, there's like a bazzilion flanks which i'm not a fan, doesn't feel great to play.

[b]Let's talk about Heroes for a bit[/b]

OW1 was fun because every hero felt very different from one another, I don't really feel like this with OW2. They also changed from 6v6 with two tanks to 5v5 with one (they buffed all tanks and changed some).
I don't really know where the balance is at right now but I have some comparisons regarding the time when OW2 launched. 

Junker Queen x Roadhog - Why the fuck would you play Roadhog if the Junker Fucker can do everything he does but way better? Roadhog was an Off-tank during OW1, he supported the main tank mitigating damage by assassinating high priority targets with the hook. He can't do that anymore because he is just a giant piece of meat that gives ult charge to the enemy team since he has no real tank capabilities, he worked best with another tank.

Old Orisa vs New Orisa - She was a protector, her lore was all about that, now she's pinning people with spears around the map. She lost her identity from protector to aggressor. The logic behind that is, Old Orisa was a main tank that heavily relied on her team to do anything at all, because she was a [b]Main Tank[/b], built to soak damage and CC the other heroes. New Orisa feels like an aggressor, like if Reinhardt was always on nanoboost ignoring everything, including the safety of your team, to always keep on top of the enemy team doing damage.

Two examples, two and my blood is already boiling.

[b]MONEY AND DISRESPECT[/b]

Overwatch 2 is plaged with microtransactions and battle passes to unlock the cosmetics, during OW1 all you needed to do to unlock cosmetics as play the game and earn loot boxes, which is not great but you could get everything the game offered by simply playing it, now you want a new or old skin(OW1) you gotta pay with real money.

Blizzard today is plain evil regarding these matters, the prices are ridiculous and even old skins cost a ton, skins that you could get playing the game in the past. It's ridiculous.

Do I need to say anything about battle passes? No, I didn't think so.

Going free-to-play was their big brain move to get more money from idiots. They also clearly spend more time thinking about new skins and battle passes than the game itself.

[b]A sad conclusion[/b]

I loved the original Overwatch, I truly did. I will never forget the feelings of a match where your team was, well, working as a team, felt amazing to jump into the fray as a tank or DPS and not worry about your HP because you knew your healer as doing their part, or as a healer not worrying about your flank because the off-tank or DPS were keeping you safe.

All I feel about Overwatch 2 is boiling rage, they destroyed everything that made the original unique.

Money and e-sports, things that simply destroy fun gaming.

They took away a game I loved shitted on it then munched on and gave it back saying it was an upgrade.

Played one match, just because that’s all I needed to see what the game I haven’t played in nearly 4 years has become.

This is a product. It has no character, no personality, no charm, no love, no life, no soul.

It’s a soulless product engineered by a soulless cooperation meant to milk every nickel and dime from the people they see as soulless wallets. I have never been more angry and sad before in ten minutes of my life from playing a game seeing what I once loved become… this. Fuck this game and everything it stands for. 

I’ll forever miss what the original Overwatch was, not what the disgusting soulless product it has become.

[h1] I Like Overwatch 2. [/h1]  But, I don't think you will. The game itself is fun, and continues to be a great source of entertainment for me and my friends. Unfortunately, the corpos of Blizzard have completely abandoned us as players, in favor of a larger cash grab. No, I don't want to spend $15 for 48 minutes of content. No, I don't want to spend $20 for a new Reinhardt skin (I would, however, love to be rewarded for the hours that I put into this game, like how I was in OW1.) But, someone will, and they know that. I don't think a majority of this is the devs' faults, just Mr. Bobby and the board wanting more money, so they rush shit out that they know isn't what they promised and let the devs take the fall. In short, feel free to play the game, but don't feel obligated to give them money. Just give it some time (or a lot of time).

Truly disgusting of Blizzard overall, they deserve all the hate.

Игра хорошая,[spoiler]  если не играть [/spoiler]

Думаю как и многие другие, я пишу этот обзор будучи игравшим в эту игру. Я начал в неё играть на playstation, затем перешёл на ПК ещё когда была 1 часть. Сразу хочу сказать, что это игра не для консоли, так что если и пробовать играть в эту "замечательную" игру, то только на ПК. И так, перейду лучше ближе к делу. Это худшая онлайн игра из всех что я играл. Именно что из всех, так как я играл во многие онлайн игры разных жанров, будь то КС ГО, ПАБГ или ГТА онлайн, это для меня оказалось самой худшой. И всё из-за того, что в игре присутствует абсолютный дисбаланс персонажей, подбора игроков, рейтинга, режимов. И ладно бы разработчики пытались как-то её улучшать, фиксить имбалансных персонажей и бафать интересных, но хуёво проделанных. Но нет, с выходом 2 части стало всё намного хуже. Они клали огромный болт на все исправления, зато добавили кучу доната на скины, которые раньше в 1 части были бесплатные, и их было интересно выбивать. Я вообще молчу про то, что 2 часть была задумана для внедрения сюжетной арки, которые они по итогу отменили, потому что фанаты этой игры СХАВАЮТ. И на самом деле это обидно, что интересная в жанровом плане для меня игра, стало абсолютно неиграбельной из-за бездарных разработчиков, которые выпустили эту игру на площадку, где они не смогут зацензурить настоящие мнения людей о них и об их творении. В общем не рекомендую данную игру к скачиванию, сэкономите больше времени и сил. Если всё-таки решились, то будьте готовы к абсолютному дисбалансу и жёсткой цензуре. Ведь в игре, создатели которой за "свободу слова", за какое-то слово сказанное в чате вас могут забанить на месяц или даже на всегда!

Man... what the hell happened to ABK. 
i was a huge blizzard fan and started playing their Games as early as the lost vikings on our amiga. i still have a huge arthas canvas on my wall, every collectors edition of WoW (played since day one) and i own every single game from this company and lots of old merch.
something bad happened after the Activision aquisition. WoW started with microtransactions, games like call of duty started their first monetization, WoW became Pay to Win with the WoW Token and then after people went away they became desperate.
Now we have a Brand from Activision called Blizzard Entertainment. Everyone that was part of the team that made ANYTHING good is long gone. Everything is just Politics, Politics and Politics. Every Game is monetized like a chinese gacha game and now we have nothing left but frustation and disappointment.

i loved overwatch. the gameplay is objectively good, it's a high quality product made by talented people... now milked to death with shop items that cost twice as much as the witcher 3 with all DLCs on a Sale. identity politics and woke ESG crap has now a higher priority than making the promised PvE Content... Characters are made with a Diversity tool that is at best sexist and racist (but "good" racist because straight, white and male characters are basically forbidden now.)

i am really frustrated because i loved WoW (i've played for 18 years and have over 30,000 Hours played), SC, Diablo (me the idiot bought the ultimate edition as a last copium attempt and got kicked in the teeth) all of their games are fundamentally great. WoW is probably the best MMO from a gameplay perspective, Overwatch is a top notch Hero Shooter, Star and Warcraft are fantastic RTS games. even heartstone is fun.

It is like a abusive relationship... this time he won't cheat on me or beat me up! i know it...
but in the end the Dragonflight, Diablo Immortal and Diablo IV and the state of CoD was the final straw after believing in this company over and over again because my childhood and my whole life to adulthood was massively influenced by WoW and Diablo.
it's time to uninstall all Games from Activision and Blizzard, the Battle net Software and call it for good this time. 
thanks for the great memories. i highly appreciate the friendships i made, the great times i had when i played with my older brother WoW at night while our parents were asleep and we missed school because we quested through stranglethorn valley. but it's finally over... Blizzard is a rotten corpse that is puppeteered by Bobby Koticks army of dark pattern researching psychologists and ESG agents and we will NEVER get our good old times in CoD Back, our first steps in Durotar, our raid nights, fun weekends in Starcraft and later on in Overwatch.

Don't give this company your hard earned money. i've spend many thousands over the last 20 years and regret every single cent.
